encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Implemented requested changes. Looks fine.
Finalized - Implemented requested changes. Looks fine.

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - In i.8, delete the iota in angled brackets; remove dot from Μιλητόν in ii.1; in ii.21 remove extra space before square bracket at [ἐς Ῥόδον], to adhere with commentary ad loc.; in ii.32 replace angled bracket with regularization <:Φείδιππός|reg|Φίδιππ[ό]ς̣:>; dot the phi in ii.34; I think the angled bracket in ii.35 is the right way to display this (metri causa) but am flagging it just in case; add acute accent to Φθείην in ii.37. Metadata: specify 2 columns in physical description; specify bookroll under book form, add 36 to 37 lines in the lines.

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - In i.8, delete the iota in angled brackets; remove dot from Μιλητόν in ii.1; in ii.21 remove extra space before square bracket at [ἐς Ῥόδον], to adhere with commentary ad loc.; in ii.32 replace angled bracket with regularization <:Φείδιππός|reg|Φίδιππ[ό]ς̣:>; dot the phi in ii.34; I think the angled bracket in ii.35 is the right way to display this (metri causa) but am flagging it just in case; add acute accent to Φθείην in ii.37. Metadata: specify 2 columns in physical description; specify bookroll under book form, add 36 to 37 lines in the lines.

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - A well-entered edition: in i.8 should we make subscript the iota in angled brackets?; remove dot from Μιλητόν in ii.1; in ii.21 remove extra space before square bracket at [ἐς Ῥόδον], to adhere with commentary ad loc.; in ii.32 replace angled bracket with regularization <:Φείδιππός|reg|Φίδιππ[ό]ς̣:>; dot the phi in ii.34; I think the angled bracket in ii.35 is the right way to display this (metri causa) but am flagging it just in case; add acute accent to Φθείην in ii.37. In general, can scribal apostrophe be placed before editorial apostrophe (since the app.crit. implies that the scribe wrote two apostrophes at ii.5, ii.7, ii.21, and ii.26)? Metadata: specify 2 columns in physical description; specify bookroll under book form

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - A well-entered edition: in i.8 should we make subscript the iota in angled brackets?; remove dot from Μιλητόν in ii.1; in ii.21 remove extra space before square bracket at [ἐς Ῥόδον], to adhere with commentary ad loc.; in ii.32 replace angled bracket with regularization <:Φείδιππός|reg|Φίδιππ[ό]ς̣:>; dot the phi in ii.34; I think the angled bracket in ii.35 is the right way to display this (metri causa) but am flagging it just in case; add acute accent to Φθείην in ii.37. In general, can scribal apostrophe be placed before editorial apostrophe (since the app.crit. implies that the scribe wrote two apostrophes at ii.5, ii.7, ii.21, and ii.26)? Metadata: specify 2 columns in physical description; specify bookroll under book form
